problem:
VS = random.choice([5.0,6.0,7.0,8.0,9.0,10.0,11.0,12.0,13.0,14.0,15.0]) Rk = random.choice([7.6,8.2,9.1,10.0]) R = Rk*1e3 VT = 1.0 Km = 20.0 K = Km*1e-3 CGSf = float(random.randrange(30,40,1)) CGS = CGSf*1e-15 Ip = 1.0 I = Ip*1e-9
tsat = CGS*VT/I Vst = VT + (-1 + math.sqrt(1 + 2*K*R*VS))/(K*R) ttriode = CGS*Vst/I
tsatm = tsat*1e6 ttriodem = ttriode*1e6
In the circuit below we show a common-source amplifier being driven by a current source. The current source turns on at time \(t=0\).
The power-supply voltage \(V_S=$VS\)V. The resistor \(R=$Rk\)k\(\Omega\). The MOSFET's parameters are: \(V_T=$VT\)V, \(K=$Km\)mA/V\(^2\), \(C_{GS}=$CGSf\)fF. The initial value of the voltage from gate to source is \(0\)V. When the current source turns on it puts out \(I=$Ip\)pA.
At what time, in microseconds, does the MOSFET leave cutoff and enter saturation?
At what time, in microseconds, does the MOSFET leave saturation and enter triode operation?
